node.title: SA on track to open next week, despite several areas with low vaccination rates
node.alt: A profile shot of SA Chief Public Health Officer Nicola Spurrier
node.description: South Australia is on track to open its borders from next week, despite low vaccination rates in several communities, the state's health chief says.Â
node.content:
["South Australia is on track to open its borders from next week, despite low vaccination rates in several communities, the state's health chief says.", "SA Chief Public Health Officer Nicola Spurrier told ABC Radio Adelaide\u00a0the Riverland, Murray Bridge, Playford and Port Adelaide's\u00a0vaccination rates were all lagging behind other areas of the state.", "Despite\u00a0those figures, authorities were not considering delaying the state's border reopening date \u2014\u00a0currently set for Tuesday, November 23.", "\"I think it's very important that people in South Australia were given a definitive date [for border reopening],\" Professor Spurrier\u00a0said.", "\"Because people make travel plans. I know many people who have businesses in Victoria haven't been able to go and see staff and organise various things with their business \u2026 so it does have an economic impact as well.", "\"So that date really is set.\"", "South Australia's approach for at-risk areas will include concentrated\u00a0testing and vaccinations after outbreaks have occurred, she said.", "\"One of the things we've learned from New South Wales and Victoria \u2026 is that there is a process of reactive immunisation,\" Professor Spurrier said.", "\"So that's what we'll be following as well.\"", "She conceded that the state may not meet its 80 per cent vaccination rate target by November 23, due to the number of people getting the jab dwindling, but believed\u00a0it would not be far off\u00a0that date.", "Meanwhile, Police Commissioner Grant Stevens told radio station FiveAA that authorities were taking a cautious approach to controlling COVID-19 when it entered\u00a0SA, between November 23 and the state reaching a 90 per cent vaccination rate.", "He said authorities were aware the state's reopening plan was \"complex\" to understand, and they hoped it would become clearer as it was implemented.", "\"We have to have a different level of response [now] than what we will have after 90 per cent,\" he said.", "\"We're stepping our way through the introduction of COVID-19 into our community \u2014 we don't know how it's going to go.", "\"If you have been exposed to COVID-19 and you are a close contact, you will have to quarantine \u2026 if you're vaccinated, that's seven days. If you're not vaccinated, that's 14 days.\"", "", "
Authorities are concerned about a COVID-19 outbreak around Katherine, but say the area's Indigenous\u00a0community has good vaccination rates.(ABC News: Isabella Higgins)
", "
Worry over Indigenous vaccination rates
", "Professor Spurrier\u00a0said she had not yet had an update from her Northern Territory counterpart regarding the\u00a0COVID-19 outbreak in Katherine,\u00a0\"but it is very concerning\".", "She said the outbreak shows \"how it is inevitable\" that COVID-19 can get in, despite borders being shut.", "", "
Vaccine models \"not as accurate\" due to drop-off in vaccinations, Professor Nicola Spurrier says.
", "\"We're obviously very concerned because it is in the Aboriginal community \u2014 but I understand from my counterpart that the rates of vaccination are quite high in some of those communities,\" she said.", "\"We've got a lot of Aboriginal people that live in metropolitan Adelaide \u2026 and of course we have some wonderful remote and regional communities as well.", "\"We just want to make sure that everyone's had access to vaccination.\"", "
Quarantine requirements for some\u00a0
", "From November 23, double-vaccinated domestic travellers will be able to come to South Australia without quarantining.\u00a0", "However, if they are travelling from a local government area (LGA) where there is community transmission and less than 80 per cent of that population is fully vaccinated, they will have to quarantine on arrival in South Australia.", "Travellers from interstate LGAs with any evidence of community transmission will be required to have a COVID-19 test within three days of arriving in South Australia.\u00a0", "Fully-vaccinated international arrivals to SA will have to quarantine for seven days.\u00a0", "Unvaccinated domestic travellers will need to apply to enter the state.\u00a0", "Borders will be open to all fully-vaccinated domestic and international travellers once 90 per cent of South Australia's population (aged 12 years and over) is\u00a0fully vaccinated.\u00a0", "Children under 12 will be treated as if they are vaccinated, since no vaccines have been approved for them.\u00a0"]
